tags.name: Assistants
tags.description: An assistant is a configured instance of a graph.

tags.name: Threads
tags.description: A thread contains the accumulated outputs of a group of runs.

tags.name: Thread Runs
tags.description: A run is an invocation of a graph / assistant on a thread. It updates the state of the thread.

tags.name: Stateless Runs
tags.description: A run is an invocation of a graph / assistant, with no state or memory persistence.

tags.name: Crons (Plus tier)
tags.description: A cron is a periodic run that recurs on a given schedule. The repeats can be isolated, or share state in a thread

tags.name: Store
tags.description: Store is an API for managing persistent key-value store (long-term memory) that is available from any thread.

tags.name: MCP
tags.description: Model Context Protocol related endpoints for exposing an agent as an MCP server.

tags.name: System
tags.description: System endpoints for health checks, metrics, and server information.

post.description:
Create an assistant.

An initial version of the assistant will be created and the assistant is set to that version. To change versions, use the `POST /assistants/{assistant_id}/latest` endpoint.

Search for assistants.

This endpoint also functions as the endpoint to list all assistants.

schema.title: Response Search Assistants Assistants Search Post

post.description: Get the count of assistants matching the specified criteria.

delete.description:
Delete an assistant by ID.

All versions of the assistant will be deleted as well.

parameters.description: Include graph representation of subgraphs. If an integer value is provided, only subgraphs with a depth less than or equal to the value will be included.

schema.title: Xray
schema.description: Include graph representation of subgraphs. If an integer value is provided, only subgraphs with a depth less than or equal to the value will be included.

parameters.name: xray

schema.title: Response Get Assistant Graph Assistants  Assistant Id  Graph Get

get.description: Get an assistant's subgraphs filtered by namespace.

parameters.description: Namespace of the subgraph to filter by.
parameters.name: namespace

post.description: Get all versions of an assistant.

schema.title: Response Search Assistants Assistants Search Post

post.description: Set the latest version for an assistant.

schema.title: Version
schema.description: The version of the assistant to change to.

post.description: Create a thread.

Search for threads.

This endpoint also functions as the endpoint to list all threads.

schema.title: Response Search Threads Threads Search Post

post.description: Get the count of threads matching the specified criteria.

get.description:
Get state for a thread.

The latest state of the thread (i.e. latest checkpoint) is returned.

parameters.description: Whether to include subgraphs in the response.

schema.title: Subgraphs
schema.description: Whether to include subgraphs in the response.

parameters.name: subgraphs

post.description: Add state to a thread.

get.description: Get state for a thread at a specific checkpoint.

parameters.description: Whether to include subgraphs in the response.

schema.title: Subgraphs
schema.description: Whether to include subgraphs in the response.

parameters.name: subgraphs

post.description: Get state for a thread at a specific checkpoint.

get.description: Get all past states for a thread.

schema.title: Response Get Thread History Threads  Thread Id  History Get

post.description: Get all past states for a thread.

schema.title: Response Get Thread History Post Threads  Thread Id  History Post

post.description: Create a new thread with a copy of the state and checkpoints from an existing thread.

schema.title: Select
schema.description: Specify which fields to return. If not provided, all fields are returned.

post.description: Create a run in existing thread, return the run ID immediately. Don't wait for the final run output.

Content-Location.description: The URL of the run that was created. Can be used to later join the stream.

post.description: Create a cron to schedule runs on a thread.
Create a run in existing thread. Stream the output.

schema.description:
The server will send a stream of events in SSE format.

**Example event**:

id: 1

event: message

data: {}

Content-Location.description: The URL of the run that was created. Can be used to later join the stream.

post.description: Create a run in existing thread. Wait for the final output and then return it.

Content-Location.description: The URL of the run that was created. Can be used to later join the stream.

get.description: Wait for a run to finish.

schema.title: Cancel on Disconnect
schema.description: If true, the run will be cancelled if the client disconnects.

get.description: Join a run stream. This endpoint streams output in real-time from a run similar to the /threads/__THREAD_ID__/runs/stream endpoint. If the run has been created with `stream_resumable=true`, the stream can be resumed from the last seen event ID.

schema.title: Last Event ID
schema.description: The ID of the last event received. Set to -1 if you want to stream all events. Requires `stream_resumable=true` to be set when creating the run.

schema.title: Stream Mode
schema.description: The mode to stream the run in. If not provided, the default mode will be used.

schema.title: Cancel On Disconnect
schema.description: If true, the run will be cancelled if the client disconnects.

The server will send a stream of events in SSE format.

**Example event**:

id: 1

event: message

data: {}

parameters.description: Action to take when cancelling the run. Possible values are `interrupt` or `rollback`. `interrupt` will simply cancel the run. `rollback` will cancel the run and delete the run and associated checkpoints afterwards.
parameters.name: action

post.description: Create a cron to schedule runs on new threads.
Search all active crons
Get the count of crons matching the specified criteria.
Create a run in a new thread, stream the output.

schema.description:
The server will send a stream of events in SSE format.

**Example event**:

id: 1

event: message

data: {}

Content-Location.description: The URL of the run that was created. Can be used to later join the stream.

post.description: Cancel one or more runs. Can cancel runs by thread ID and run IDs, or by status filter.

parameters.description: Action to take when cancelling the run. Possible values are `interrupt` or `rollback`. `interrupt` will simply cancel the run. `rollback` will cancel the run and delete the run and associated checkpoints afterwards.
parameters.name: action

post.description: Create a run in a new thread. Wait for the final output and then return it.

Content-Location.description: The URL of the run that was created. Can be used to later join the stream.

post.description: Create a run in a new thread, return the run ID immediately. Don't wait for the final run output.

Content-Location.description: The URL of the run that was created. Can be used to later join the stream.

post.description: Create a batch of runs in new threads, return immediately.

post.summary: Search for items within a namespace prefix.
List namespaces with optional match conditions.

post.description:
Implemented according to the Streamable HTTP Transport specification.
Sends a JSON-RPC 2.0 message to the server.

- **Request**: Provide an object with `jsonrpc`, `id`, `method`, and optional `params`.
- **Response**: Returns a JSON-RPC response or acknowledgment.

**Notes:**
- Stateless: Sessions are not persisted across requests.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Accept header must include both 'application/json' and 'text/event-stream' media types.

application/json.description: A JSON-RPC 2.0 request, notification, or response object.

202.description: Notification or response accepted; no content body.

400.description: Bad request: invalid JSON or message format, or unacceptable Accept header.

500.description: Internal server error or unexpected failure.

get.description: Implemented according to the Streamable HTTP Transport specification.

405.description: GET method not allowed; streaming not supported.

delete.description:
Implemented according to the Streamable HTTP Transport specification.
Terminate an MCP session. The server implementation is stateless, so this is a no-op.

get.description: Get server version information, feature flags, and metadata.
Get system metrics in Prometheus or JSON format for monitoring and observability.

schema.title: JSON Metrics
schema.description: Metrics in JSON format including queue stats, worker stats, and HTTP metrics

get.description: Check the health status of the server. Optionally check database connectivity.

context.title: Context
context.description: Static context added to the assistant.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The time the assistant was created.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The last time the assistant was updated.

assistant_id.title: Assistant Id
assistant_id.description: The ID of the assistant. If not provided, a random UUID will be generated.

graph_id.title: Graph Id
graph_id.description: The ID of the graph the assistant should use. The graph ID is normally set in your langgraph.json configuration.

config.description: Configuration to use for the graph. Useful when graph is configurable and you want to create different assistants based on different configurations.

context.title: Context
context.description: Static context added to the assistant.

if_exists.title: If Exists
if_exists.description: How to handle duplicate creation. Must be either 'raise' (raise error if duplicate), or 'do_nothing' (return existing assistant).

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the assistant. Defaults to 'Untitled'.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the assistant. Defaults to null.

graph_id.title: Graph Id
graph_id.description: The ID of the graph the assistant should use. The graph ID is normally set in your langgraph.json configuration. If not provided, assistant will keep pointing to same graph.

config.title: Config
config.description: Configuration to use for the graph. Useful when graph is configurable and you want to update the assistant's configuration.

context.description: Static context added to the assistant.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Metadata to merge with existing assistant metadata.

name.title: Name

description.title: Description
description.description: The new description for the assistant. If not provided, assistant will keep its current description.

end_time.title: End Time

interrupts.title: Interrupts

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: The ID of the thread. If not provided, a random UUID will be generated.

if_exists.title: If Exists
if_exists.description: How to handle duplicate creation. Must be either 'raise' (raise error if duplicate), or 'do_nothing' (return existing thread).

strategy.description: The TTL strategy. 'delete' removes the entire thread.

ttl.description: The time-to-live in minutes from now until thread should be swept.

metadata.title: Metadata

checkpoint.title: Checkpoint

ThreadStateCheckpointRequest.title: ThreadStateCheckpointRequest
ThreadStateCheckpointRequest.description: Payload for getting the state of a thread at a checkpoint.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: The maximum number of states to return.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Filter states by metadata key-value pairs.

values.title: Values
values.description: The values to update the state with.

checkpoint.title: Checkpoint
checkpoint.description: The checkpoint to update the state of.

as_node.title: As Node
as_node.description: Update the state as if this node had just executed.

ThreadStateUpdate.title: ThreadStateUpdate
ThreadStateUpdate.description: Payload for updating the state of a thread.

command.description: The command associated with the update.

as_node.description: Update the state as if this node had just executed.

ThreadStateUpdateResponse.title: ThreadStateUpdateResponse
ThreadStateUpdateResponse.description: Response for adding state to a thread.

thread_id.description: Unique identifier for the thread associated with this checkpoint.

checkpoint_ns.description: Namespace for the checkpoint, used for organization and retrieval.

checkpoint_id.description: Optional unique identifier for the checkpoint itself.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: A list of strings representing the namespace path.

key.title: Key
key.description: The unique identifier for the item within the namespace.

value.title: Value
value.description: A dictionary containing the item's data.

StorePutRequest.title: StorePutRequest
StorePutRequest.description: Request to store or update an item.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: A list of strings representing the namespace path.

key.title: Key
key.description: The unique identifier for the item.

namespace_prefix.title: Namespace Prefix
namespace_prefix.description: List of strings representing the namespace prefix.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Optional dictionary of key-value pairs to filter results.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of items to return (default is 10).

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of items to skip before returning results (default is 0).

StoreSearchRequest.title: StoreSearchRequest
StoreSearchRequest.description: Request to search for items within a namespace prefix.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Optional list of strings representing the prefix to filter namespaces.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: Optional list of strings representing the suffix to filter namespaces.

max_depth.title: Max Depth
max_depth.description: Optional integer specifying the maximum depth of namespaces to return.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of namespaces to return (default is 100).

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of namespaces to skip before returning results (default is 0).

namespace.description: The namespace of the item. A namespace is analogous to a document's directory.

key.description: The unique identifier of the item within its namespace. In general, keys needn't be globally unique.

value.description: The value stored in the item. This is the document itself.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the item was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the item was last updated.

Item.description: Represents a single document or data entry in the graph's Store. Items are used to store cross-thread memories.

status.title: Status
status.description: Filter runs by status to cancel. Must be one of 'pending', 'running', or 'all'.

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: The ID of the thread containing runs to cancel.

run_ids.title: Run Ids
run_ids.description: List of run IDs to cancel.

ErrorResponse.title: ErrorResponse
ErrorResponse.description: Error message returned from the server
